When we got Lucyâ€™s STXBP1 diagnosis, the doctor and social worker that called us away from our very sick newborn in the NICU to give us the news didnâ€™t know anything about her rare disease. They handed us papers they printed from the Nation Organization for Rare Disorders and said 300 people worldwide (incorrect number) have this diagnosis, there is no treatment and all you can do is try to manage seizures and therapy for global development delays. We fell straight into the deep end of finding out how little is known about these rare diseases and how strong we have to be to fight for Lucy. Rare disease life was beyond my comprehension before getting my sweet Lucy Bug and our life is so different from everyone around us, so much so itâ€™s impossible to explain. Be the love today for our STXBP1 community â¤ï¸ Today is Giving Tuesday and itâ€™s a perfect time to show some love to the @stxbp1_foundation 
Lucy was diagnosed at just 3 weeks old and has fought for her life and works with all her might to gain strength every single day. There is no cure for her rare genetic disorder so our only way forward towards a treatment is through awareness and donations from people who care about our families. Every donation helps ğŸ’™ Check my story for the link to give. #LucysLight #cureSTXBP1 #stxbp1
